document.heading: Food Stamp Trafficking and Public Assistance Fraud Control Act of 1998

history.narrative: Law 12-254, the “Food Stamp Trafficking and Public Assistance Fraud Control Act of 1998,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-520, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 1, 1998, and December 15, 1998, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 29, 1998, it was assigned Act No. 12-602 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-254 became effective on April 20, 1999.
